page.title: 06 GROVE MANOR FARM
page.content: Mr.Vincent owns the farm.He grows three different crops;Galahad wheat,which is sold for animal feed, blackcurrants, which are sent to Wales to be made into Ribena (blackcurrant juice) and apples.He grows mainly Coxes but he also grows some early varieties to pollinate the Coxes, these are Discovery, Golden Delicious, George Cave and Worcesters. A hailstorm has spoilt a lot of apples this year. There are 81 acres of blackcurrants and 2178 bushes to an acre, about 176,000 bushes.They have to be pruned by hand in the winter.They are sprayed by a tractor and sprayer.There is a special harvester which bends the branches over to either side and shakes the currants off onto a conveyor belt. Mr.Vincent employs 2 men full-time and 8 women part-time to help with the work.There is a very big tithe barn.
